definition: contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
the more knowledgeable, the more reactionary (absurd anti-intellectual slogan attributed after the event to the Gang of Four 四人幫|四人帮)
pinyin: zhi1 shi5 yue4 duo1 yue4 fan3 dong4

definition: If the father is a hero, the son is a real man. If the father is a reactionary, the son is a bastard. (Cultural Revolution slogan)/fig. like father, like son
pinyin: lao3 zi5 ying1 xiong2 er2 hao3 han4 , lao3 zi5 fan3 dong4 er2 hun2 dan4
containing_words.word: 老子英雄兒好漢，老子反動兒混蛋

sentences.english: Among the whites in the United States it is only the reactionary ruling circles who oppress the black people.
sentences.chinese: 在美國壓迫黑人的，只是白色人種中的反動統治集團。

sentences.english: Everything reactionary is the same; if you don't hit it, it won't fall.
sentences.chinese: 凡是反動的東西，你不打，他就不倒。

sentences.english: We'll never compromise with the reactionary forces.
sentences.chinese: 我們決不向反動勢力妥協。

sentences.english: His efforts were defeated by the forces of reaction .
sentences.chinese: 他的努力被反動勢力挫敗。

sentences.english: The new "Ming" will just react to the "Qing" policies.
sentences.chinese: 新“明”會是“清”的政策反動。

sentences.english: This novel criticizes the peasants' uprising and sing the praises of the reactionary rulers.
sentences.chinese: 這本小說批判農民起義，但對反動統治者歌功頌德。

sentences.english: We definitely do not apply a policy of benevolence to the reactionaries.
sentences.chinese: 我們對反動派決不施仁政。

sentences.english: The reactionary elements attempt to set back the clock of history. They're doomed to failure.
sentences.chinese: 反動分子企圖使歷史倒退，他們是註定要失敗的。

sentences.english: The reactionary police fired on the crowd, wounding one youngster.
sentences.chinese: 反動警察向羣衆開槍，打傷了一個青年。

sentences.english: All reactionaries are paper tigers. In appearance, the reactionaries are terrifying, but in reality they are not sopowerful.
sentences.chinese: 一切所有號稱強大的反動派統統不過是紙老虎。

sentences.english: The reactionaries will never, of their own accord, step down from the stage of history.
sentences.chinese: 反動派決不會自行退出歷史舞臺。

sentences.english: Generally, over the period, the doctrines of intellectual reactionaries enjoyed the supremacy.
sentences.chinese: 一般來說，在這個時期，有智識的反動。

sentences.english: Shakespeare's metamorphosis subverts the Ovidian model.
sentences.chinese: 詩中的”變形“是對奧維德的反動。

sentences.english: Dear webmaster, my English message mentioned-above is not inaccurate at all. Why did you delete it?
sentences.chinese: 親愛的吧主，額上述英文帖並不反動，爲何要刪哦？

sentences.english: He was free from all sycophancy or obsequiousness in the face of the reactionary ruling class.
sentences.chinese: 他在反動統治階級面前沒有絲毫的奴顏與媚骨。

definition: to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
Taiwan independence/(of Taiwan) to declare independence
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
united front (abbr. for 統一戰線|统一战线[tong3 yi1 zhan4 xian4])
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
